title: How to Make Edible Sand

steps.headline: Blend the chocolate and whole graham crackers in a food processor.
steps.description: Blend on high speed for about a minute or two, until the graham crackers resemble the consistency of sand. You can also crumble the crackers by placing them in a Ziploc bag and whacking it with a rolling pin. This process takes a little more effort but it works just as well.

steps.headline: Pour the crumbled graham crackers into a large bowl.
Add the white sugar.
steps.description: Stir in the sugar with a mixing utensil. If necessary, add extra sugar to make the sand lighter in color.

steps.headline: Use the edible sand.
steps.description: The edible sand can be used for desserts (e.g cakes, pudding, cookies, etc. ), decoration, or playing. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Blend the cookies in a food processor.
steps.description: Blend on high speed for about a minute or two, until the cookies resemble the consistency of sand. You can also crumble the cookies by placing them in a Ziploc bag and whacking it with a rolling pin. This process takes a little more effort but it works just as well.

steps.headline: Pour the crumbled cookies into a large bowl.
Add the brown sugar.
steps.description: Stir in the sugar with a mixing utensil. If necessary, add extra sugar to make the sand darker in color.

steps.headline: Use the edible sand.
steps.description: The edible sand can be used for desserts (e.g cakes, pudding, cookies, etc. ), decoration, or playing. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Blend the almonds in a food processor.
steps.description: Blend on high speed for about a minute or two, until the almonds resemble the consistency of sand. At this stage, you are welcomed to use the grounded almonds as your edible sand if you don't mind the pale color it resembles.

steps.headline: Pour the crumbled almonds into a large bowl.
Blend the walnuts in a food processor.
steps.description: Blend on high speed for about a minute or two, until the walnuts resemble the consistency of sand.

steps.headline: Pour the crumbled walnuts in with the almonds.
Use the edible sand.
steps.description: The edible sand can be used for desserts (e.g cakes, pudding, cookies, etc. ), decoration, or playing. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 250° Fahrenheit (121° Celsius).
Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Crumble up the leftover cake scraps on the baking sheet.
Bake the cake scraps for about 20-30 minutes.
steps.description: The scraps should be dry and slightly crunchy.

steps.headline: Let the cake scraps cool for about 10 minutes until warm.
Blend the dried cake in a food processor.
steps.description: Blend on high speed for about a minute or two, until the cake resembles the consistency of sand.

steps.headline: Use the edible sand.
steps.description: The edible sand can be used for desserts (e.g cakes, pudding, cookies, etc. ), decoration, or playing. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Pour the cornmeal into a medium-sized bowl
Add both packets of Kool-Aid.
steps.description: Stir well with a mixing utensil.

steps.headline: Pour in the water.
Mix until the mixture is a vibrant yellow color and it spreads evenly.
Use the edible sand.
steps.description: Although the sand is edible, it is best to use this for decoration, crafts, and playing only. It is not a tasty treat on top of desserts.
